availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eliza Ann Cartwright Redd (Trigg County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Daughter of James A. Cartwright and Adeline Graves Cartwright. Married to John Redd in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 10, 1840. Mother of James W. Redd, George S. Redd, Theodore Redd, John T. Redd, and Eliza A. Redd. Resident in Trigg County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 306B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 295.
KYR-0001-020-0001.
